required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Galcanezumab (LY2951742) in Participants 6 to 17 Years of Age With Episodic Migraine
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Study of Galcanezumab in Patients 6 to 17 Years of Age With Episodic Migraine - the REBUILD Study

brief_summary.textblock: The main purpose of this study is to determine the safety and efficacy of the study drug galcanezumab in participants 6 to 17 years of age with episodic migraine.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in the Number of Monthly Migraine Headache Days
primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in the number of monthly migraine headache days

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participants with Reduction from Baseline ≥50% in Monthly Migraine Headache Days
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of participants with reduction from baseline ≥50% in monthly migraine headache days

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in the Number of Monthly Headache Days with Nausea and/or Vomiting
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in the number of monthly headache days with nausea and/or vomiting

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in the Number of Monthly Headache Days with Photophobia and Phonophobia
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in the number of monthly headache days with photophobia and phonophobia

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in the Number of Monthly Migraine Headaches with Prodromal Symptoms
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in the number of monthly migraine headaches with prodromal symptoms

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in the Number of Days on Which Acute Migraine Treatments are Taken per Month
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in the number of days on which acute migraine treatments are taken per month

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in the Number of Monthly Headache Days
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in the number of monthly headache days

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline on the Pediatric Quality of Life Inventory (PedsQL) Total Score
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline on the PedsQL total score

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline on the Pediatric Migraine Disability Assessment test (PedMIDAS) Total Score
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline on the PedMIDAS total score

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline on the Patient Satisfaction with Medication Questionnaire-Modified (PSMQ-M)
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline on the PSMQ-M

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with Suicidal Ideation and Behaviors Assessed by the Columbia Suicide Severity Rating Scale (C-SSRS) Score
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of Participants with Suicidal Ideation and Behaviors Assessed by the C-SSRS Score

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma Concentration of Calcitonin Gene-Related Peptide (CGRP)
Percentage of Participants Developing Anti-Drug Antibodies
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants developing anti-drug antibodies

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participants who Initiate Migraine Prevention Medication
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of participants who initiate migraine prevention medication

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Have a diagnosis of migraine as defined by the International Headache Society International Classification of Headache Disorders (IHS ICHD-3) beta guidelines (1.1 or 1.2) (ICHD-3 2013), with a history of migraine headaches of at least 6 months prior to screening.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participants who are taking, or are expected to take, therapeutic antibodies during the course of the study (adalimumab, infliximab, trastuzumab, bevacizumab, etc.). Prior use of therapeutic antibodies, other than antibodies to calcitonin gene-related peptide (CGRP) or its receptor, is allowed if that use was more than 12 months prior to baseline.
- Known hypersensitivity to multiple drugs, monoclonal antibodies or other therapeutic proteins, or to galcanezumab or its excipients.
- Current use or prior exposure to galcanezumab, another CGRP antibody, or CGRP receptor antibody, including those who have previously completed or withdrawn from this study or any other study investigating a CGRP antibody.
- History of persistent daily headache, cluster headache or migraine subtypes including hemiplegic (sporadic or familial) migraine and migraine with brainstem aura (previously basilar-type migraine) as defined by IHS ICHD-3 beta.
- History of any type of headache except for migraine, tension type headache, or medication overuse headache, as defined by IHS ICHD-3 beta, in the 3 months prior to randomization. For example, a history of post-traumatic headache in this 3-month period would not be allowed.
- History of traumatic head injury, associated with significant change in the quality or frequency of their headaches, including new onset of migraine following traumatic head injury.
- Participants with a known history of intracranial tumors or developmental malformations including Chiari malformations.

link.description: A Study of Galcanezumab (LY2951742) in Participants 6 to 17 Years of Age With Episodic Migraine

patient_data.ipd_description: Lilly provides access to the individual patient data from studies on approved medicines and indications as defined by the sponsor specific information on ClinicalStudyDataRequest.com. This access is provided in a timely fashion after the primary publication is accepted. Researchers need to have an approved research proposal submitted through ClinicalStudyDataRequest.com. Access to the data will be provided in a secure data sharing environment after signing a data sharing agreement.
